segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We return to Timmony, a kingdom to the north of Dol-Makjar and Kahad, where on the King's Highway headed southeast towards Arderin, our friends retrace their steps, though not so faithfully, for you came to Tybry's Lea from the Miller's Road, the magical path that the Hounds of the King had led you on. Now we find Thimble and Teor hidden in a wagon, venturing back south under open daylight, trying to keep hidden their secret cargo; the stolen stone statue that in truth is the body, neither living nor dead, of your brother, Talcydimir Pridesire.
segments.summary: Opening narration establishing the party's location and current situation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The wagon trundles along. Outside you hear the voices of Kattigan, Tyranny, and Wick nearby. We come to this moment as you make your way southeast, back to the road that will lead you to Dol-Makjar and to Bolaire, who you know to have at least some means by which to counteract petrification. In this moment, you both gaze on the face of Cyd Pridesire, frozen in statuesque rictus, stone face. The face looks quite similar to Teor. You have this long, trundling road ahead of you as you reenter danger once again. But with at least a day's travel of respite in the beautiful countryside of Timmony.
segments.summary: Setting the scene inside the wagon with the petrified Cyd

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: You know, Dol-Makjar is foreign to me. I feel like we should feel good about going back to friends and some sort of resolution, but I am full of anxiety.
segments.summary: Teor expresses anxiety about returning to Dol-Makjar

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Well, yeah, they want to kill you there. So. (chuckles)
segments.summary: Thimble acknowledges the danger Teor faces

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: They don't want to kill me. They want to strip my shadow from my being. It's very different.
segments.summary: Teor clarifies the specific threat he faces

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Well, if the Tachonises didn't have reason to hurt us before, they do now. So now we'll have a few families after us.
segments.summary: Thimble mentions the Tachonis family now being against them

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: How are we going to get my brother through the city? Even if we get to Bolaire, a giant lion is one thing. Made of stone, entirely other. How do you--? You've lived here. Are you able to--? I was going to ask if you hide, but not the same.
segments.summary: Teor asks about smuggling his petrified brother into the city

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Not quite. But let me think. You know, I mean, Thaz and I got a lot of stuff into the city. There's got to be one of those routes are open, right?
segments.summary: Thimble considers smuggling routes she used with Thjazi

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: A smuggler's route?
segments.summary: Teor confirms what Thimble is suggesting

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah, my only concern is that we, we attacked the Crow Keepers. So... But, you know, maybe I can scout ahead as we get closer and see if any of them are open and we can come in a different way. I can't imagine we can go through the gates.
segments.summary: Thimble explains complications with the Crow Keepers and suggests scouting

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: No, I don't imagine so.
segments.summary: Teor agrees about not using the gates

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Are you going to be able to carry him if we have to ditch the wagon?
segments.summary: Thimble asks about Teor's ability to carry the statue

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: No. I mean, he is rock. He is stone.
segments.summary: Teor explains he cannot carry the petrified statue

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: You're stone, too, Teor.
segments.summary: Thimble makes a comment about Teor being strong

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh, thank you. That's very kind.
segments.summary: Teor responds to Thimble's compliment

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah.
segments.summary: Thimble affirms her compliment

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I tend to agree, but no, the cart is going to be the only way. Unless you have some sort of alternative magical means?
segments.summary: Teor insists they need the cart and asks about magical alternatives

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thimble, you can give me a perception check, and I'd also like an insight check from you.
segments.summary: DM requests dice rolls from Thimble

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Okay, this is the insight.
segments.summary: Laura acknowledges the roll request

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Spit on him and make him a picture.
segments.summary: Travis makes a joke while Laura rolls

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: My insight is 16, my perception is nine.
segments.summary: Laura reports her dice roll results

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Gotcha.
segments.summary: DM acknowledges the roll results

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Dang.
segments.summary: Travis reacts to the rolls

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You remember seeing the knight of Seremai, who you faced in the cellars of Castle Delawney, heave the stone statue with those bracers.
segments.summary: DM reminds Thimble about the knight using bracers to lift the statue

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Hmm.
segments.summary: Travis reacts to the information

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: The bracers! That guy wasn't strong, he used the bracers.
segments.summary: Thimble realizes the solution to their strength problem

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh, from the huge--
segments.summary: Teor starts to respond about the bracers

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Did you put them on? Who put them on? Did anybody put them on?
segments.summary: Thimble asks urgently about the bracers

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: They look best on me, I mean.
segments.summary: Teor indicates he has the bracers

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Get them on, put them on.
segments.summary: Thimble urges Teor to use the bracers

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Make them yours.
segments.summary: Teor attempts to attune to the bracers

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I am wearing them.
segments.summary: Teor confirms he's wearing the bracers

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Work. Make me strong! (laughter)
segments.summary: Teor commands the bracers to work

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: (continued ad banter and transitions)
segments.summary: Continued ad segment banter

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: What else we got, Matt?
segments.summary: Transition from ads to game

segments.speaker: Matt Mercer
segments.content: I believe that concludes our announcements. So let's get back into Aramán!
segments.summary: Matt transitions back to the game

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hello and welcome to another episode of Critical Role. We return to Riesingürtle, the seat of House Einfasen, rulers of the country of Helvar.
segments.summary: Brennan opens the episode with location recap

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Having journeyed east through the Dvalmar Pass, our companions and adventurers found themselves here in Riesingürtle, a massive belt of a city, the Giants' Belt stretching across the cliffs overlooking the far western edge of the old and fallen Obridimian Empire.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps their journey and describes the city

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Having arrived in time for some chicken and apple cobbler and staying in a very vertical hostel and discovering, Julien with some quick spy work, seeing that some of the Candescent Creed here in the city preparing for Candle Feast were none other than demon Aspirants, the sisters of one Tyranny, currently elsewhere in the region of Timmony.
segments.summary: Recap of discovering demon Aspirants and Tyranny's sisters

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Looking for a chance to get through the city, the decision was made actually to approach House Einfasen with Occtis Tachonis disguised as Erlich Kerzingblad, a knight who, it turns out, enjoys a rather sterling reputation.
segments.summary: Recap of Occtis's disguise plan

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: In tow, Sir Julien Davinos, who happened to connect on potentially even a chivalrous and romantic level with the young Lady Ingrid Einfasen. A beautiful young woman, tall and fair. A little self-conscious about her shoulders. We're not going to hold that against her. Everyone's got their thing.
segments.summary: Recap of Julien's connection with Lady Ingrid

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: A few members of our party got to enjoy a lovely hot bath. Not so Julien Davinos, who had to climb to the tall tower, taking quite some pains to get a letter sent back to the Golden Orchard to inform his family of what might have transpired.
segments.summary: Recap of party's activities and Julien sending a letter

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: House Einfasen proved themselves maybe not party to the treachery of House Tachonis, but perhaps their embrace of their ally, House Royce, was not as warm or forthcoming as it might have been. Some conversation with the Lady Aranessa alone from the brutal and violent, although seemingly, at least not in this moment, actively moving against you, Lord Otto Einfasen.
segments.summary: Recap of House politics and Lord Otto's nature

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: After coming together, Julien with his bottles of wine, Occtis having sent Pin out with some companions, Thaisha seeing a carriage of the Tachonis immediately after Occtis' summoned undead vulture, who should not have returned quickly, did.
segments.summary: Recap of suspicious events with the vulture

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Racing through the streets of Riesingürtle, having basically ascertained that you could not be certain of your safety. You didn't feel like, I guess, gambling on how the conversation between Occtis' eldest sisters, Petra and Ryah, two tall, gaunt sorceresses of the House of Tachonis, naturally gifted of the magic that Occtis has spent many years laboring over in The Penteveral.
segments.summary: Recap of fleeing and Occtis's sisters

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You raced through the streets, and the decision was made to not gamble on the pulley gate not being there at the edge of the city, and instead went to Schongarten, the druidic holy site here within Riesingürtle.
segments.summary: Recap of going to Schongarten

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Entering through the sanctuary gate, your horses stabled, you found the longhall fragrant with wood smoke and other sleeping pilgrims and traveling druids, those whose business has taken them through the Dvalmar Pass or here to the Kavrosi Mountains and found a place of rest.
segments.summary: Description of the druidic sanctuary

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Summoned up to the central glacial boulder, this massive lichen-covered circular stone. This boulder is so enormous that it almost stands as wide as the floor of a cathedral. Enormous dolmens topped with sideways plants covered in ancient Druidic, a language that combines some of the core phonemes and script of both Giant and Sylvan and some of the earliest and most primordial languages of Aramán.
segments.summary: Description of the sacred boulder and druidic writing

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You stand under the moonlight with three elders of different circles of the Old Path. There is Amadah, the bearfolk druidess who sits on her haunches, still about a foot taller than you sitting. You see that there is Mozor, who is the caretaker of this holy place, Schongarten, who is a dwarven druid of the Circle of Stone, and an as yet unintroduced elven druid of the Hunt who beholds you now in this place.
segments.summary: Introduction of the three druid elders

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thaisha, what is going through your mind as the words of Hannan echo in your ears? You have brought something dead to this place.
segments.summary: Brennan asks Thaisha about her reaction to the accusation

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: It's that mingled-- The first instinct is, of course, defensiveness. Occtis is my friend, so it's defensiveness. Defensiveness on his behalf and then defensiveness on my behalf. He is my friend and my judgment is sound. Who are these people to ask nothing, but assume immediately? All of that is being slowly walked back to: Have a normal conversation, everything's fine. You don't have to start at a 10. You were around the Einfasens for 20 minutes. Calm down. You have an orange. Use your orange, use your orange.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains her defensive reaction and attempts to calm herself

segments.speaker: Amadah
segments.content: If it is all right, can you help us to understand?
segments.summary: Amadah asks Thaisha to explain

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: Gladly, yes. In that little moment where I have to decide how much truth to offer because we've only been in Riesingürtle for a little bit and I've already been rightfully called out for giving a bit too much away immediately. But I wouldn't have come here if I didn't implicitly trust in the strength and wisdom of my people. Truth. Young Occtis Tachonis was slain by his family, and at some point in his death was able to be turned from the path. He's returned, but I've spent time in Venatus, and I have walked this world for decades. I know well the undead that we seek to remove as a threat from the world, and he is not that. He is something different. Very much himself, but-- Something new is walking on the face of Aramán, and I call him my friend.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains Occtis's situation and nature

segments.speaker: Amadah
segments.content: Can I offer you a blessing, if that is all right, my cousin?
segments.summary: Amadah offers to bless Thaisha

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: That is incredibly gracious. I gratefully accept.
segments.summary: Thaisha accepts the blessing

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She places a massive paw on your back, lowers her head to be forehead to forehead with you, her long bear-like snout pressing up against your face and chin. She says, 'To walk always free amongst the family of living things, to know no confusion, charm, or sinister words. To be free of body, mind, and soul.' She snorts and the smell of jasmine and honeysuckle comes out of her nose, and she casts a spell of restoration on you that would destroy any charm condition or dominating effect or anything like that.
segments.summary: Amadah performs a blessing/restoration spell on Thaisha

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: I think when Thaisha pulls back, there is a single little tear going down her eye because there is always that little fear. I think there's something in a world where magic does exist, trust, perfect trust is really hard to come by. There is something very nice about knowing that there are people looking out for you. So that was treated truly as a blessing and not as a sign of doubt or disbelief.
segments.summary: Thaisha describes her emotional reaction to the blessing

segments.speaker: Amadah
segments.content: Your friend, have you come to know him as your friend after the events of his rising?
segments.summary: Amadah asks about when Thaisha befriended Occtis

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: We traveled together for six months before his death. He was my friend then.
segments.summary: Thaisha clarifies she knew Occtis before his death

segments.speaker: Hannan
segments.content: You knew him in life.
segments.summary: Hannan confirms this detail

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy
segments.content: Yes. Whatever he is now I still consider more adjacent to life than undeath, for what it's worth.
segments.summary: Thaisha defends Occtis's current nature

segments.speaker: Mozor
segments.content: When these companions came to the door of this place, four living footfalls fell upon the stone, not five.
segments.summary: Mozor reveals he can sense the undead nature

segments.speaker: Amadah
segments.content: Hannan, would you, would you allow a conversation?
segments.summary: Amadah asks Hannan to permit discussion

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hannan crosses his arms and says,
segments.summary: Hannan prepares to respond

segments.speaker: Hannan
segments.content: I see no need for urgency in this regard. We are in a holy place, and I am not so detached from the earth that I cannot smell and sense the one of which we speak. And I can sense that he is not running.
segments.summary: Hannan states there's no urgency and that he can sense Occtis isn't running

segments.speaker: Hannan
segments.content: Were you present for the magic responsible for the raising of this undead?
segments.summary: Hannan questions if Thaisha witnessed the magic that raised Occtis

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I was.
segments.summary: Thaisha confirms she was present

segments.speaker: Hannan
segments.content: What made you of it?
segments.summary: Hannan asks for Thaisha's assessment of the magic

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: A relic, old, connected to the Shaper of Life. I do not know it well, but it was leveraged by his family. His father told me that his goal via this, via other plans that I still don't understand, was to scrub the Old Path from this world. Whatever happened to Occtis, the corruption of that ritual that allows him to stand here, whatever he is, is a flaw in their plan. Whatever he is is something that House Tachonis has never accounted for and doesn't understand, and we don't understand it either. If I thought he needed to be hidden, I would have hidden him from you and everyone else that would seek to do him harm without understanding first.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains the ritual involved a relic of the Shaper of Life, meant to destroy the Old Path, but Occtis represents an unplanned flaw

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me an insight check.
segments.summary: DM calls for insight check

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Alex, I swear to god, if it's a natural one, I'm going to fight you. It's a four.
segments.summary: Aabria makes insight check with poor result

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I'm not fighting.
segments.summary: Alexander responds to Aabria's comment

segments.speaker: Julien (Matt)
segments.content: Three away.
segments.summary: Matt comments on the roll

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Nine!
segments.summary: Aabria announces final roll result

segments.speaker: Hannan
segments.content: A relic of the Shaper of Life? Came you by this or the Tachonis first?
segments.summary: Hannan asks who possessed the relic first

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: House Tachonis had it in their possession when they attacked the Palazzo Davinos.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains House Tachonis possessed the relic during the attack

segments.speaker: Amadah
segments.content: Your companions are very tied up in this. Is that fair to say?
segments.summary: Amadah notes Thaisha's companions are deeply involved

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: It is.
segments.summary: Thaisha confirms her companions are involved

segments.speaker: Amadah
segments.content: Perhaps we should speak with all involved.
segments.summary: Amadah suggests speaking with all of Thaisha's companions

segments.speaker: Hannan
segments.content: You don't think it wise to settle this matter between us first?
segments.summary: Hannan questions if they should resolve things privately first

segments.speaker: Amadah
segments.content: The conviction of our cousin of the Circle of Ancients is sincere. We're all wrong from time to time, of course, but you believe it.
segments.summary: Amadah acknowledges Thaisha's sincere conviction

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yes, I do.
segments.summary: Thaisha affirms her conviction

segments.speaker: Amadah
segments.content: The Tachonis had a relic of the Shaper of Life and they wished to destroy the Old Path?
segments.summary: Amadah seeks clarification about the Tachonis plan

segments.speaker: Mozor
segments.content: Do you mean us, or--? No, you mean the Path itself.
segments.summary: Mozor clarifies the target of destruction

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: The Path. They have made of themselves, in the time since the fall of the Shapers, into new middlemen in the cycle of life and death. I think they seek to be the only game in town.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains House Tachonis seeks to control death entirely

segments.speaker: Hannan
segments.content: The Tachonis of old were middlemen, as you say, but they knew their place, guardians of the spirits of man shepherding the souls of mortal humans to that endless golden paradise beneath the rays of the sun. I suppose they don't fashion themselves as taking a demotion.
segments.summary: Hannan describes the traditional role of House Tachonis and suggests they resist their diminished status

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: No. What I've noticed from even my brief stays in Dol-Makjar as of late is the Sundered Houses don't quite know what to do with themselves without Shapers to follow. And I think they are all trying to find new shapes for themselves closer and closer to their lost deity.
segments.summary: Thaisha observes that the Sundered Houses struggle without Shapers and seek to emulate their lost gods

segments.speaker: Hannan
segments.content: The raising of this friend disrupted the ritual.
segments.summary: Hannan confirms the raising disrupted the ritual

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yes.
segments.summary: Thaisha confirms the disruption

segments.speaker: Hannan
segments.content: Is your friend necessary for the completion of the ritual?
segments.summary: Hannan asks if Occtis is needed to complete the ritual

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: The thing you ask I will answer honestly, but in that honesty, I will tell you that I am concerned that that might move us both closer to action that I would not consider very familial. I don't know.
segments.summary: Thaisha warns her honest answer might lead to conflict and admits uncertainty

segments.speaker: Amadah
segments.content: Cousin, were you present for the magic that did this thing to your friend?
segments.summary: Amadah asks if Thaisha witnessed the magic affecting Occtis

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: For some amount of it, yes. He was slewn when I reached him in the middle of a pitched fight. I was knocked unconscious, and in the place between places, spoke with him briefly as he wandered before setting a foot on the Path. I don't know what effect the words of a grief-stricken and panicked friend may have had on this. And whatever brought him back, I was there. I held his body, but I don't know what that magic was. I don't know if I had any effect.
segments.summary: Thaisha describes witnessing Occtis's death, speaking with his spirit, and being present for his return

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I'm going to roll an insight check in front of the board.
segments.summary: DM rolls insight check openly

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: This goes so well for us.
segments.summary: Alexander comments sarcastically on the situation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: What's your passive deception?
segments.summary: DM asks for passive deception score

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh, what? Oh gods.
segments.summary: Aabria reacts with concern

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: We have to hide the stone.
segments.summary: Vaelus mentions hiding a stone

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Can you see it?

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: I think it's pretty hidden.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Great. Great.
segments.summary: DM responds to the hidden stone

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: I'm not going to ask. Wait, is--

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Do you want to try to find it?

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: No.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah, I will have walked in a minute after that.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: Right. So, are we in a place with friends or do we have to run again?
segments.summary: Julien asks if they're safe or need to flee

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thaisha's doing that weird messing with your hair when it's on the back of your neck, and she's got a series of metal plates that go down where her vertebrae is, and they are all red hot and she's trying to get them to cool off
segments.summary: Description of Thaisha's agitated state with glowing metal vertebrae

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: We need to go have a conversation with my cousins.
segments.summary: Thaisha says they need to speak with her druid cousins

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Yeah, I thought that might happen.
segments.summary: Occtis expected this confrontation

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Do they know he's here?
segments.summary: Vaelus asks if the druids know about Occtis

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: They know he's here, they know what he is, and they know some manner of how his current status came to be.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains the druids' knowledge of Occtis

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: They're not going to let him stay.
segments.summary: Julien assumes the druids won't allow Occtis to remain

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: If we have to leave, then we leave. The entire intention here was just to make a safe exit from the city.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains their plan was just to escape the city safely

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Okay. Let me go talk to some druids who hate me.
segments.summary: Occtis prepares to face the hostile druids

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: They don't hate you. I'm not lying to you.
segments.summary: Thaisha corrects Occtis about the druids' feelings

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: They are worried about you-- because they don't know what you are.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains the druids are concerned, not hateful

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: They're not coming here, are they? Do we have to go to them?
segments.summary: Occtis asks about the meeting location

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: No, we'll go to them.
segments.summary: Thaisha confirms they'll go to the druids

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You guys step out and return to the small summit of this holy grotto, this beautiful little alpine garden. As you approach, everyone here give me an insight check.
segments.summary: The party approaches the druid tribunal and is asked to make insight checks

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On a nat 20, Occtis' existence is not particularly in danger. His freedom very much might be.
segments.summary: DM reveals Occtis isn't in mortal danger but may lose his freedom

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: There's a large staircase at the back of the grotto that doesn't go into the main city and goes up to the Hachvallen Brücke, which is a large memorial bridge over some cascading waterfalls that come off the cliffs. You would just recognize that because that goes to a more scenic, natural part of the cliffs, it has ways to get to the actual cliffside if you wanted to try something fucking risky.
segments.summary: DM describes an escape route via the Hachvallen Brücke memorial bridge

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On your approach, nobody here seems to recoil at your approach.
segments.summary: The druids don't show immediate hostility to Occtis

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I would like to cast Shield of Faith on Occtis.
segments.summary: Vaelus secretly casts protective magic on Occtis

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Walking up that final step, Hannan looks to you, his eyes trained on this undead, and then dart to Vaelus. And his lip curls and he goes into a crouch.
segments.summary: Hannan the druid shows hostility toward Vaelus upon seeing her with Occtis

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Do not make me regret that I told my friends this was a place that they did not need to run from, Cousin.
segments.summary: Thaisha warns Hannan in Druidic not to threaten her companions

segments.speaker: Hannan (DM)
segments.content: Cousin, the one who walks beside you does not recognize the sanctuary of this place! The one who walks beside you is nothing more than a cruel and careless follower of the dead tyrants! And you walk knowingly at her side? Do you know what she would have seen become of us? Do you know what rightful place she sees you holding in this world? She is nothing more than a mindless follower of those who sought to plunge us into ruin and terror forever!
segments.summary: Hannan accuses Vaelus of being a follower of dead tyrants in Druidic

segments.speaker: Hannan (DM)
segments.content: Slit her throat on the stone. Let the earth be watered by her blood.
segments.summary: Hannan demands Thaisha kill Vaelus in Druidic

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see that feathers are growing off of Hannan's back in this moment as he is crouched down. You see he spits a word out at you. He goes, 'Menelas!' Which is Elven for 'flower doll.'
segments.summary: Hannan partially transforms and calls Vaelus 'menelas' (flower doll) in Elven

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So, elven druids were some of the most persecuted, tortured, and killed druids of the world. The Goddess of Life was a goddess of forests. She married the King of Faerie. The term 'flower doll' or 'menelas' was a term of joy and love because they had religious significance in the petitioning of Sylandri by her elven faithful. When the Shapers' War started, and for the first time in thousands of years, elven druids actually were welcomed as some elves started to rebel. In one of the early speeches that was given to convince a family group of elves to come into the rebellion, the term 'menelas' was used to describe the highest ambitions of the faithful elves. That what they wanted to be was the flower dolls of the Goddess of Life forever. And it basically became a-- you don't want to be free. You don't want to find truth. You don't want to live as a being of the world of Aramán. You have your mother and you wish to be her flower doll forever.
segments.summary: DM explains the historical context and derogatory meaning of 'menelas' related to elven druids and the Shapers' War

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: The tone at which you used that leads me to believe you are being unkind. And I believe this meeting is about me, not about her. I would hope that you would get to know someone before being aggressive.
segments.summary: Occtis confronts Hannan for insulting Vaelus and redirects attention to himself

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: My eyes that have been subtly glowing green since he came back flare a little bit. Pin's buttons go venom green. and all of you watch that Occtis' shadow from the small lit sconces of this holy grove stretch behind him. All of you feel a tremendous cold fall upon this place and see that a small rivulet of the stream running by the holy brook here freezes solid in this moment. The veil between life and death is extremely fragile here.
segments.summary: Occtis displays intimidating undead power, freezing part of the stream and making the area cold

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: She has been very kind to me, and I will not allow you to be unkind to her for no reason.
segments.summary: Occtis defends Vaelus from Hannan's hostility

segments.speaker: Amadah (DM)
segments.content: Cousins, cooler heads. Let us all speak in Kahadi so that all can understand all the words that we use in this holy place.
segments.summary: Amadah calls for calm and suggests switching to Common language

segments.speaker: Amadah (DM)
segments.content: Cousin, our task here is to keep this grove and garden safe.
segments.summary: Amadah reminds Hannan of their duty to protect the sacred space

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: what I'm trying to do!" She turns and says, "Traveler, have you come here to despoil or befoul this holy place?"
segments.summary: Hannan questions Vaelus's intentions

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: No.
segments.summary: Vaelus denies harmful intent

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Have you come here--" Hannan turns to Amadah and says, "Ask her if she accepts the sanctuary offered by this holy place." Amadah looks at you and says, "Do you seek and accept the sanctuary offered by this holy place?"
segments.summary: The druids formally offer sanctuary to Vaelus

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Is it being offered?
segments.summary: Vaelus questions the sanctuary offer

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "It is being offered to those--"
segments.summary: Amadah begins to explain the sanctuary

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: By you?
segments.summary: Vaelus clarifies who is offering sanctuary

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Vaelus. Kindness for kindness.
segments.summary: Thaisha encourages Vaelus to accept

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Kindness.
segments.summary: Julien echoes the sentiment

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: (exasperated sigh) Yes, I accept this most generous of sanctuaries.
segments.summary: Vaelus reluctantly accepts sanctuary

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hannan does not take his eyes off of you.
segments.summary: Hannan maintains intense stare at Vaelus

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Same.
segments.summary: Vaelus stares back at Hannan

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I think in this moment, too, Thaisha, looking at Hannan, you see, elven immortality is so strange and so unlike anything that any of the peoples of Aramán deal with. I think in this moment, you just see-- You're in your early forties. The Shapers' War is still happening. It's happening right here in this moment. It's out of living memory for you. Even this immortal undead creature, he's the farthest away from the Shapers' War of any of you.
segments.summary: Brennan reflects on the weight of immortality and the ongoing trauma of the Shapers' War

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: He hasn't aged.
segments.summary: Thaisha observes Hannan's unchanging nature

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I think you see in this moment that each of the people in this circle having this interaction obviously had people that died and it's the other person's fault. And it's extremely-- It's happening right now. Amadah looks and says--
segments.summary: The weight of past conflicts and losses affects everyone present

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Immediately, Occtis just smiles and lets everything go. Hi.
segments.summary: Occtis defuses tension with friendly greeting

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "My Lord Tachonis."
segments.summary: Amadah formally addresses Occtis

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Bows very deeply.
segments.summary: Occtis shows deep respect

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "My cousin Mozor has some questions for you. He was happy to invite you into this grotto."
segments.summary: Amadah introduces Mozor and explains the invitation

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: And I appreciate it so much. I will happily answer any questions to the best of my ability.
segments.summary: Occtis expresses gratitude and willingness to cooperate

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Mozor turns and says, "The path you tread, what are your aims here in this place? what are your aims here in this place? And moreover, your time as a living thing in this world has passed, your time as a living thing in this world has passed, and you did not walk to find new life. and you did not walk to find new life. Instead, you have sought to hold fast to your name and body. I say this without anger or bitterness."
segments.summary: Mozor questions Occtis about his undead state and intentions

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Mm-mm. It is a little, I think, more complicated It is a little, I think, more complicated than a decision that I made. It wasn't.
segments.summary: Occtis explains his undeath wasn't his choice

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "In your mind, do you have some inkling as to what this ritual was for?" "do you have some inkling as to what this ritual was for?" By the way, Thaisha, to recall, did you say that the relic was with you?
segments.summary: Mozor asks about the ritual while Brennan checks on the relic's location

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I know--
segments.summary: Occtis begins to respond

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I did not speak to that.
segments.summary: Thaisha clarifies she hasn't revealed the relic's location

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: No.
segments.summary: Occtis denies knowledge

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He says, "The relic of the Shaper of life, do you know what became of it?"
segments.summary: Mozor asks about the Shaper relic

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I'll try and lay this out as well as I can, being that I don't fully understand what happened.
segments.summary: Occtis prepares to explain his situation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I need a deception check from Vaelus at this moment.
segments.summary: Brennan calls for deception check from Vaelus

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I'm assuming you know who my family is. I am the eighth child of my House and I was born without its sorcerous abilities. and I was born without its sorcerous abilities.
segments.summary: Occtis explains his background as a powerless Tachonis

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Oh, that was so close to being a natural 20.
segments.summary: Ashley comments on her dice roll

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I, through a series of events, found my way when I was, well, only about six months ago now, a little over, began adventuring with Ms. Lloy, and we became friends while I was very much alive. There were another series of events. We ended up in Dol-Makjar together where my family killed me and much of House Royce and Davinos. Occtis will open his shirt and show the mended piece of metal that is holding him shut. You can see where they opened me up. They took my heart and placed a stone inside of me, which I believe is the relic you're referring to.
segments.summary: Occtis reveals how his family killed him and placed the relic in his chest

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: What did we get on the deception check, Ashley?
segments.summary: Brennan asks for Ashley's deception roll result

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.summary: Ashley reports her deception roll

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Hmm.
segments.summary: Matt reacts to the roll

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Mm.
segments.summary: Aabria reacts to the roll

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Mm.
segments.summary: Alexander reacts to the roll

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Which I think is... pretty good. (laughter)
segments.summary: Ashley comments on her mediocre roll result

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah, it's so good.
segments.summary: Aabria sarcastically agrees

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Pretty solid. (chuckling)
segments.summary: Matt sarcastically agrees

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: It's like (pulsing). (laughter)
segments.summary: Ashley mimics the relic's pulsing

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Just a big lump in your shirt.
segments.summary: Alexander describes the obvious relic bulge

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Yeah. (laughter)
segments.summary: Ashley agrees about the obvious relic

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Amadah looks to you.
segments.summary: Amadah focuses attention on Vaelus

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Can you see it?
segments.summary: Thaisha asks if the relic is visible

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Aranessa actually puts a hand on your back. Right before that, you get a Message cantrip in your mind, Julien, that just says, "Sort of fun to not be the center of attention. Do you have a way for us to get out of here?"
segments.summary: Aranessa contacts Julien via magic about escape plans

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: I whisper: I think I have a possible exit. Yes.
segments.summary: Julien confirms he has an escape plan

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Great. If we need to, pick up whichever one of us you feel is slowest and I will ask the spirits of the Golden Orchard to hasten our exit. And she says, "And if no one takes you up on it, I'll do it."
segments.summary: Aranessa offers backup escape assistance

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: And you see that she puts a hand on your shoulder and says, "We stand in a grove of the Circle of Stones whose sacred charge in the tending of these mountains is appreciated and endeavors to leave a sense of gratitude throughout all members of House Royce. My Lord Tachonis is a born ally of House Royce, and stands as the last faithful member of his house, to my knowledge, to the compact sworn in the age of my father."
segments.summary: Thaisha vouches for Occtis to the druids

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Clear that something altogether miraculous has happened with you. We are given to comfort those who have lost their loved ones and we ask them to accept that death is a part of life. There are many undead things in this world that seek to cling to life for reasons of slaughter, selfishness. I know that I tell you nothing new. We have made it our life's work to make sure that this world is a world filled with life. To consider you a threat in this moment would be the height of foolishness. One day, perhaps, I will ask you to consider if your time on this earth has concluded, but for right now, you represent the first thing that has felt like hope to me in quite some time. Cousin, thank you for engaging in something this reckless."
segments.summary: Hannan explains the druids' philosophy about life and death, expressing that Occtis represents hope despite being undead

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Thank you for trusting that a conversation could be had.
segments.summary: Thaisha thanks Hannan for being willing to talk

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Always. We do not move hastily. We speak, we consider, we listen to the earth. But who knows, maybe we should have been a little more hasty. Seems to have worked for you, my cousin. I am sorry to have visited this tension upon you."
segments.summary: Hannan reflects on the druids' cautious nature versus the party's hasty actions

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: No, I fully understand why you would be uncertain and worried. You should know that two of my sisters are in Riesingürtle and they are, I don't know what they're doing, but we saw them before we left, and just keep an eye out. I don't have much I can do at this current moment with them. They're far more powerful than I am, but I'm hoping I'll be able to figure something out in the future.
segments.summary: Occtis warns about his sisters being in Riesingürtle and acknowledges their greater power

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Where to from here?"
segments.summary: Hannan asks about their travel plans

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: What was the name?
segments.summary: Thaisha asks for clarification on a name

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: East to Gerwyn. Our immediate destination.
segments.summary: Julien states their destination as Gerwyn to the east

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She looks up and says "There are eagles across the Hachvallen Brücke. Is your urgency so great that you would wish to travel at once or would you welcome rest?"
segments.summary: Amadah offers eagle transport across the Hachvallen Bridge and asks about their urgency

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I leave that to you.
segments.summary: Thaisha defers the decision to others

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: The longer we stay, the better chance we have of being surrounded or taken. If your sisters are indeed here, then, my vote is to make haste.
segments.summary: Julien advocates for leaving quickly due to the danger from Occtis's sisters

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We return to the Hachvallen Brücke. Here, the beautiful waterfalls of Riesingürtle descend towards a cliff plunge some 200 feet that will see them scatter on the western border of Helvar. The water is cold, the ice clinging to the sides up here at this high altitude, and we see before us the spiraling chapels and this gatehouse. Beyond the gatehouse, probably up some, not too far away, but up a small winding stone staircase in the side of the cliff, you see the site of a massive aerie, and you see up there, Julien, who, in a moment, we'll get everybody's initiative, but those with high perception, Julien, Vaelus, you see up here, above, there is a massive series of nests. The nests appear to be about 20 feet in diameter.
segments.summary: The party has arrived at the Hachvallen Brücke, a bridge with waterfalls and a gatehouse. There's a massive aerie with 20-foot diameter nests visible above.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Looking out, you see a column of Tachonis soldiers walking out in front of you, and you see that, right in front of you, Mozor has just changed his accent and yelled an expletive. Can I get initiatives from everybody?
segments.summary: Tachonis soldiers are approaching and Mozor has revealed himself by changing his accent.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Julien, you are first to act as you see the knight over here at the head of this marching order. You don't recognize, from this distance, any insignia on his shield, but from some vassal house of Tachonis, calling out, saying, 'Stand down at once! You are under arrest under the authority of House Tachonis!'
segments.summary: Combat begins with a Tachonis knight ordering the party's arrest.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: So we take them out and keep going?
segments.summary: Julien asks if they should fight the Tachonis forces.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yep.
segments.summary: Thaisha confirms they should fight.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: All right. I'm going to move forward 30 feet. And I'm going to use my action. I'm going to hold my action to have my blade at the ready, hidden behind with the cloak in front, hiding the demi-gauntlet. And just kind of use that position to, protecting you, if he's going to try and rush past-- to get to my friends or if anybody comes close to me, I'm going to shank them.
segments.summary: Julien moves forward and readies an attack action while hiding his blade.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see that, in this instance, what's going to happen here is Mozor walks up and looks over at you, Julien, and says, 'Everything all right?'
segments.summary: Mozor approaches Julien pretending to be concerned.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: I just hold the blade between him and the people ahead of us. He's like: Let's see what your next move is, if this blade finds your neck or theirs.
segments.summary: Julien threatens Mozor with his blade.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see, as Mozor turns to look at you, his eyes go blood red as he says, 'Well, then why don't you just burn?' And you, instead, nothing happens on a 22. You feel a flush of some kind of powerful, fiery thing, and a smell of sulfur fills the space as Enmity stands before you.
segments.summary: Mozor reveals himself as Enmity, attempting to cast a fire spell on Julien but failing due to his successful save.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On a success, you do take seven points of fire damage, as you feel a flash of fire and blood, but you see that Enmity readies an action next to you.
segments.summary: Despite saving, Julien takes 7 fire damage and Enmity readies an action.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: As the impact of the heat burns through me and I react from it for a second, shake it off, throw the cloak back, and can I use my readied action to just-- I'm not going to take that lying down! That's going to be, oh, okay. 21 to hit. That'll be 10 points of piercing damage with the rapier.
segments.summary: Julien uses his readied action to attack Enmity with his rapier, hitting for 10 damage.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The rapier flashes out, hyah! Enmity throws up one of her arms. A slash of blood across the forearm. '(growls) You should know not to keep our quarry from us.'
segments.summary: Julien's attack hits Enmity's arm, causing a bloody wound. Enmity threatens about keeping their quarry from them.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see this dude is going to come rushing up. He charges. 'Guards, put them under arrest!' Five, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40, 45, 50, 55, 60. Whole turn, move and dash, just closing distance with you guys.
segments.summary: The Tachonis knight charges forward 60 feet, calling for the party's arrest.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Shit. Okay, so I see Enmity appear where Mozor was. Okay. Shit. But then knowing that you pointed off to the real one, I'm like: Okay, so this is a fake. Okay, so what Occtis is going to do is move. I think. I'm just going to be right here. And then is going to look at the House Tachonis vassals and just say: As a scion of House Tachonis, stand down!
segments.summary: Occtis realizes Enmity replaced Mozor and moves forward, then commands the Tachonis soldiers to stand down using his authority as a scion of House Tachonis.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On a 20 persuasion, you see the guards tremble in this moment. The knight in front of you, the one charging here, says, "My Lord Tachonis, what be your first name?"
segments.summary: Guards are questioning Occtis's identity

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Shit. I don't know my siblings' names. (chuckles)
segments.summary: Alexander realizes he doesn't know his character's family names

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Check your character sheet.
segments.summary: Aabria suggests Alexander check his sheet

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Yeah, I got it, I got it, I got it. Frons!
segments.summary: Alexander finds the name on his sheet

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see, give me-- You have a 20 persuasion. You'll do this with advantage. Give me deception.
segments.summary: DM calls for deception roll with advantage

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You need to hit a 20 here.
segments.summary: DM sets difficulty at 20

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.summary: Alexander rolls 18 on deception

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Oh! This is simply too funny. I am going to have to do this. Frons raises his visor. (laughter)
segments.summary: The knight reveals himself to be Frons

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Tough news, little brother."
segments.summary: Frons reveals he's Occtis's brother

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: That's so funny. You had a one in eight shot.
segments.summary: Aabria comments on the odds

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Ah, well, hi. (laughter) And then Occtis snaps his fingers and Pin appears right next to Frons.
segments.summary: Occtis awkwardly greets his brother and summons Pin

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Before you do this, I am going to have to resolve something, though. This is going to affect your turn. Enmity's readied action goes off in this moment as she turns to Frons.
segments.summary: Enmity's readied action triggers

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We are going to roll an incredibly important saving throw right now as Enmity points to Frons and says, "Come to the aid of your ally, House Halovar, now!" And is going to cast Dominate Person on Frons Tachonis.
segments.summary: Enmity casts Dominate Person on Frons

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On a 13 or higher, Frons saves. This kind of-- This kind of isn't good or bad for you. It's just different. 13 or higher, he saves. Nat 20!

Then with the wind blowing past, my hair tossed to the side, I step down about four feet onto the edge where the cliff is and looking down at him: (sighs) One down. And I slowly clamp my foot onto his gauntleted hand and kick him off the edge.

segments.content: You cook a man in his armor. As you rush out and stand, "(screaming)" as just (raspy inhale) you guys can smell. It smells like a barbecue.
segments.summary: The guard screams as he's cooked in his armor, creating a barbecue smell

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah, with that barbecue and heat and steam-- the Fog Cloud dissipates. I'm going to look at the rest of them and go: You're going to want to stay down!
segments.summary: Thaisha's heat dissipates the Fog Cloud and threatens the remaining guards

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Cruelty turns to look at the bridge, the Fog Cloud still standing there. Turns around and goes, "(petulant huff) I told you we should have gone north!" (whooshes) And turns and you see, Occtis, as you're about to run over the bridge, right before you fade into the mist, you see that she (whooshes) turns into you and goes, "Bye." And walks off off the bridge.
segments.summary: Cruelty shapeshifts into Occtis's form and leaves the bridge

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You-- These guards are going to use half their movement to stand up from prone, see you, Thaisha, and they're going to swing.
segments.summary: Guards stand up from prone and attack Thaisha

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You take nine points of damage. Across these two. The last one deals five points of damage to you.
segments.summary: Guards deal 14 total damage to Thaisha

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Okay, in that case, all of you guys can see this unfolding as the guards get up and try to-- (grunts) You see Thaisha standing in the middle of five spearmen attacking. As they-- "(grunts)" Thaisha, you move to the side quickly, and even standing here, this burning metal underneath you, this aura of heatwave surrounds you as many of the spears miss
segments.summary: With fog cleared, party sees Thaisha fighting five spearmen with heat aura around her

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: As the highest-ranking member of the Tachonis House currently present, stand down!
segments.summary: Occtis commands the ballista to stand down using his noble authority

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I'm going to ask for a persuasion check. This is going to be a DC 20, but I'll allow you to roll with advantage.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Natural 20.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: My Lord, all of these are your allies and companions?
segments.summary: The ballista guards ask Occtis to confirm his companions' status

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Yes!
segments.summary: Occtis confirms his companions as allies

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan) as Agony
segments.content: Thank you!
segments.summary: Agony thanks Occtis for including her in his protection

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Ugh.
segments.summary: Occtis realizes he accidentally protected Agony

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Aranessa is going to rush up here and then take a readied action for when the way is cleared, to dash again. Agony is going to heal herself, rush over here, and tumble off the side of the cliff.
segments.summary: Aranessa prepares to dash when the way clears while Agony heals and escapes over the cliff

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: You owe me!
segments.summary: Occtis calls out to Agony as she escapes

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: I'm going to dart towards the ones that attacked Thaisha and rapidly go into a full run with the rapier to the side.
segments.summary: Julien rushes to attack the guards who attacked Thaisha

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: A natural one.

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: So I just punch him in the head. That's going to be a 22 to hit. That's going to be eight points of bludgeoning damage.
segments.summary: Julien successfully punches a guard after his sword strike missed

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: I will use my Hasted action to then turn around with the rapier and then try and shank him, more or less, in the abdomen. That's going to be a 16 to hit. He takes 11 points of piercing damage.
segments.summary: Julien kills a guard with his rapier using his hasted action

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Running up, that first one exposes his full abdomen and side, and the length of the rapier to the basket hilt goes through his midsection as he collapses dead in that instant.
segments.summary: The guard is killed instantly by Julien's rapier thrust

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: Then I will then dart up and around with the rest of my speed to flank the one that's next to him also on Thaisha on this side.
segments.summary: Julien moves to flank another guard near Thaisha

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: With advantage on him, that would be 20. So with that, I get the sneak attack because I had advantage on the attack against him. That's going to be 12 points of damage.
segments.summary: Julien kills the second guard with a sneak attack

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You rush through and with the Action Surge, he is dropped. Both of those on that side of Thaisha have been slain in this turn.
segments.summary: Julien kills both guards threatening Thaisha in one turn

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: She said, 'Stand down.'
segments.summary: Julien reminds the remaining guards of the order to stand down

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: He just full run and dash towards the garrison there.
segments.summary: Occtis runs and dashes toward the garrison

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Run, you idiots!
segments.summary: Occtis tells Julien and Thaisha to run as he passes them

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: Yes, I will start booking it out. Dash, all the things.
segments.summary: Vaelus runs and dashes to escape

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Actually, you were the first one to make it all the way through the gate, sprinting off into the night.
segments.summary: Vaelus is the first to escape through the gate

segments.speaker: Aabria Iyengar (Thaisha)
segments.content: I'm going to put my hand on your shoulder then and nudge you forward and cast Cure Wounds as I do so. 12 points.
segments.summary: Thaisha heals Julien for 12 points while encouraging him to move

segments.speaker: Aabria Iyengar (Thaisha)
segments.content: Bonus action, I cook a dead man in his armor. I said, 'Stay down!'
segments.summary: Thaisha uses her bonus action to burn a dead guard's corpse

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: These men are going to close on Julien. That is only one hit for seven points of damage.
segments.summary: The remaining guards attack Julien but only one hits for minimal damage

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: That all you got? I can do this all day.
segments.summary: Julien taunts the guards after taking their attack

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan) as Aranessa
segments.content: Julien, run!
segments.summary: Aranessa calls for Julien to retreat as she moves through the gate

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: I'm going to attack the one that's closest to the exit. That's going to be a 17 to hit. Hit him for 10 points of piercing damage.
segments.summary: Julien attacks the guard closest to the exit, badly injuring him

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: I'm going to use my bonus action to use my gauntlet to grab him by the chin. That'll be a 21 to hit. Seven points of bludgeoning damage.
segments.summary: Julien kills the guard with his gauntlet after stabbing him

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: I will use my Hasted action to strike the next guy in the order. That's a natural 20. 12 points of piercing damage on that guy.
segments.summary: Julien scores a critical hit and kills another guard

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You, once again, golden moths and butterflies composed of light as you just-- the sword is flashing faster than the eye can see.
segments.summary: Julien's divine magic manifests as golden light creatures during his combat

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: I'll leave one to survive to go back to your patron and tell the House, a Davinos will see them fall now.
segments.summary: Julien threatens the last guard with a message for House Tachonis

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: Then I'll use the rest of my Hasted movement, which at this point would be 50 feet or so? To catch up with the rest of the troop.
segments.summary: Julien uses his remaining movement to catch up with the party

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Oh, now you run.
segments.summary: Occtis sarcastically comments on Julien finally retreating

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Occtis, you are the last one left on this side of the gate. It is your turn. There's one guard left standing and the tw
segments.summary: Occtis is the last party member on the bridge side of the gate with one guard remaining

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I look at the one last guard as I pause by the door for a second and look at that last guard and just: (sighs) Good luck. I just take off.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (whooshes) You rush through the doors. As you see the shadows of the gate behind you, you hear. (wind oscillating)

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Is there a mechanism within there to close the gate?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The gate is actually, there is-- There is a gate and a portcullis. You see that the gate is open, and there is also a rope holding the portcullis up.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: As I run by, can I use my action to undo the rope?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You absolutely can. Prestidigitation.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: So the portcullis comes down.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (gate slams) The portcullis closes as, (haunting wind whooshes) as we exit initiative. Just for fun.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (whooshes) Two twin sisters (rasping exhales) manifest.
segments.summary: Two twin sisters appear

segments.speaker: Aabria Iyengar (Thaisha)
segments.content: Look at those cuties.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Just out of line of sight, not being able to see over the bridge. Occtis, as your feet, thump, thump, thump, you hear the faintness of someone casting Detect Magic and noticing Frons' name written in stone. As you see up here, you guys racing into the shadows as fast as you can as you hear the ballista operators up here.
segments.summary: Occtis flees while someone detects Frons' name with magic

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As the ballista archers calling down saying, "Who goes? Who goes there?" Shouting to the bridge, looking through the dark as these two women look at each other and hear footsteps racing into the dark. I am going to need, in this moment, a group stealth check from all of you.
segments.summary: Guards call out and demand stealth checks

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: It's a 19 on the die for Aranessa.
segments.summary: Aranessa rolls 19 for stealth

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: Dirty 20.

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer (Julien)
segments.content: I will note just because we're keeping this honest. Haste only lasts for a minute. When it drops, we're all in a full sprint, suddenly you watch Julien fall to one knee. (panting) And is incapacitated for a round.
segments.summary: Haste spell ends, Julien becomes incapacitated

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: I pick him up.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Vaelus, you shoulder Julien with one arm. With a dirty 20, 19, and 18, 19 is our median roll here. You guys rush into the dark as fast as you can up the stone steps towards the aerie. Down below (dry breathing) as you see (whooshes) mist rise from a spell cast on that bridge by the two twin sorceresses, peering out into the darkness as your footsteps vanish into the city. That's all for this episode.
segments.summary: Party successfully escapes to the aerie while twin sorceresses cast spells below

segments.speaker: Alexander Ward
segments.content: I was like: Fucking run!

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson
segments.content: That was so stressful. That was so fun.

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer
segments.content: I killed so many Tachonises!

segments.speaker: Alexander Ward
segments.content: Well, one Tachonis and a couple other vassal house guys.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah, a couple of guys who knew the job was dangerous when they took it and one guy who definitely deserved it. Oh my goodness. That was exemplary work. How frightening and also how deeply absurd. As you guys depart, we'll have to get back into seeing if your eagles await, for everyone.

segments.speaker: Alexander Ward
segments.content: Just a bear up there being like, "What took you so long?"

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: That took max, a minute. Stop. One of us had to pee.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You're all good. I know, that was what? Three or four rounds. So you had a couple rounds of sprinting top speed before the incapacitation hit. For all of our friends at home, the only thing left to say is: Is it Thursday yet?

segments.speaker: Matthew Mercer
segments.content: Hey, let's fucking like, get some sage and smudge those dice, Ashley. What the fuck?

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson
segments.content: Let me see if I roll it now if it makes anything different. 17, that's awesome.
